intro: Adenosacme scortechinii, commonly known as the Italian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Adenosacme scortechinii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade conditions.
